channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-10340] [BACKPORT] HBASE-9892 Add info port to ServerName to support multi instances in a node
item.description: Backport this patch after testing it does not break anything.
item.summary: [BACKPORT] HBASE-9892 Add info port to ServerName to support multi instances in a node

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: We need HBASE-10334 if this goes into 0.96 and 0.94.
This seems somewhat important, let's get it in.
Yes. Helps when running > RS per node.

From what I remember form the review, it should be fine. We had to keep BC for rolling upgrades between 0.96 and 0.98, so 0.96.x -> 0.96.2 should work equally good. Don't forget to backport HBASE-10334 as well after this.

I applied to 0.96 (thanks for reminder on the including hbase-10334 Enis Soztutar). Let me test it tomorrow Lars Hofhansl to make sure can have a cluster that has a mix to make sure it ok before 0.94.

Patch works nicely for me. Brought up RS w/ this patch applied and it played nicely in a cluster where others did not have the patch applied. Then brought up new master. That worked. Then I started second regionserver on same node and master was able to see two RS and from the UI I could click through to both. Let me apply to 0.94.
Committed to 0.94 and to 0.96. Resolving. I don't think 0.94 needs the ancillary HBASE-10334. Checking in HBASE-10484
